subject: Education
title: Elaboration: Connecting New to Known
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Elaboration: Connecting New to Known.

hook.text: Students who ask 'why does this make sense?' remember 300% more than those who simply read the same information.

buildup.text: Elaboration means explaining new information in your own words and connecting it to what you already know.

discovery.text: The more connections a new memory has to existing knowledge, the more retrieval routes exist ‚Äî making it easier to find.

twist.text: This is why experts learn faster: they have more existing knowledge to connect new information to. Knowledge begets

climax.text: Elaboration turns isolated facts into integrated understanding. The question 'why?' is the most powerful learning tool

punchline.text: The three most powerful words in learning aren't 'I don't know.' They're 'But

quiz.question: How does elaboration improve learning?
options: By creating connections between new and existing knowledge
